title: siblings: should provide a way to list all known (to git-annex) remotes (siblings)
body:
ATM seems to show only "enabled" siblings:
```shell
$> git clone http://datasets.datalad.org/crcns/aa-1/.git
Cloning into 'aa-1'...
remote: Counting objects: 22913, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (11030/11030), done.
remote: Total 22913 (delta 9039), reused 22788 (delta 8988)
Receiving objects: 100% (22913/22913), 1.89 MiB | 2.44 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (9039/9039), done.

$> cd aa-1

$> datalad siblings                                     
.: here(?) [git]
.: origin(?) [http://datasets.datalad.org/crcns/aa-1/.git (git)]
```
and I think it would be nice to list at least some from:

```shell
$> git annex info  
...
semitrusted repositories: 7
	00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001 -- web
 	00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002 -- bittorrent
 	1e41b9cf-4479-4ef1-8c66-e6cfbf861f2e -- datalad
 	3dee27a1-32f5-494c-b484-d3cbdcefa356 -- yoh@lena:/tmp/aa-1 [here]
 	79080a38-0e94-4a0a-bd89-9022eada547b -- yoh@smaug:/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/crcns/aa-1
 	895b9a07-6613-4c8a-95ae-280d8119475c -- datalad-archives
 	fa2495e7-17ae-44de-9c6b-e737ee445d6e -- yoh@falkor:/srv/datasets.datalad.org/www/crcns/aa-1 [origin]
```

My guess would be to filter out those starting with `000000...` but report others, with information on either they are known git annex special remotes as listed in
```
$> git show git-annex:remote.log                                
1e41b9cf-4479-4ef1-8c66-e6cfbf861f2e autoenable=true encryption=none externaltype=datalad name=datalad type=external timestamp=1464124519.012356s
895b9a07-6613-4c8a-95ae-280d8119475c autoenable=true encryption=none externaltype=datalad-archives name=datalad-archives type=external timestamp=1464124520.081473s
```
showing which could be enabled.
